com.larphoid.lanudpcomm

Interface ClientEventHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LanUDPComm

    public interface ClientEventHandler
    © 2013 Larphoid Apps.
    Since:
    05-09-2013
    Author:
    Ralph Lussenburg

    This interface is used to report received data and client disconnecting, back to your application.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

    • Method Detail

      • onClientEvent

        void onClientEvent(byte[] data,
                 int offset,
                 int dataLength,
                 java.net.DatagramPacket pack)
        Callback that receives data that was send either with LanUDPComm.sendClientPacket() or LanUDPComm.sendClientPacket(String) for a connection that was previously established with LanUDPComm.inviteClientForConnection(int, String, String[]).

        There are two methods to use for communication. One for 'fast' binary data, and one for simple String data. It is 'fast' because if there are a lot of events and you need to send data other than String data, it can be very slow if you first have to convert it into a String.
        Parameters:
        data - A byte array which holds your application specific data, to use for communication between the 2 clients. To simply convert to a String, use: new String(data, offset, dataLength - offset).
        offset - The offset of the data in the byte array. You can use ByteBuffer to wrap the byte array and ByteBuffer.position(offset) to advance the byte array to this position.
        dataLength - The length of the data that is stored in the byte[] array.
        pack - Included for convenience reasons. The DatagramPacket holds all the information about the data that was received.
        See Also:
        For information on how to use data communication, see {@link LanUDPComm#sendClientPacket()} and {@link LanUDPComm#sendClientPacket(String data)}.

      • onClientEndConnection

        void onClientEndConnection(java.net.DatagramPacket pack)
        Called when a client ends the connection.
        This is usefull for example for games to end the game state, or for chat-like applications to keep track of client status. If not needed, simply do nothing in this callback method.
        If you want a dialog displayed to inform this client that the target has ended the connection, call yourLanUDPCommInstance.onClientEndConnection(DatagramPacket).

      • onClientNotResponding

        void onClientNotResponding(java.net.DatagramPacket pack)
        Called (if you have a LanUDPComm.needAliveConnection when a client is not responding anymore (no longer sending 'keepalive' packets).
        This is usefull for example for games to end the game state. If not needed, simply do nothing in this callback method.
        If you want a dialog displayed to inform this client that the target is not responding anymore, call yourLanUDPCommInstance.onClientNotResponding(DatagramPacket).
